config.question: Which of the following occurred as a consequence of the Glorious Revolution in 1869?

choices.content: The Dominion of New England’s governor Sir Edmund Andros was jailed.
The ruling class of England appointed James II as the king.
The Dominion of New England was renamed the Union of New England.
More powers were given to the general court and the governor’s veto power was removed.

answer_3.response: When news of the Glorious Revolution reached Boston, the Bay colonists overthrew the hated Andros regime. Governor Andros was jailed without a shot having been fired.
